what: Include some data examples in your package
title: Get started

what: The first function of the package: Calculate the median of a vector
title: Get started
code: my_median(1:12) #> [1] 6.5  # Example with your dataset in "inst/" datafile <- system.file("nyc_squirrels_sample.csv", package = "pulso2") nyc_squirrels <- read.csv(datafile) # Apply my function my_median(nyc_squirrels[,"hectare_squirrel_number"]) #> [1] 3

what: Funciones Para Los Informes Pulso PUCP
title: Funciones Para Los Informes Pulso PUCP
text: El objetivo del paquete pulso es facilitar la elaboración de los informes del Área de Proyectos del Instituto de Analítica Social e Inteligencia Estratégica Pulso PUCP.

title: Funciones Para Los Informes Pulso PUCP
text: Puede instalar la versión en desarrollo de pulso2 desde GitHub con:

title: Funciones Para Los Informes Pulso PUCP
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(pulso2) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
